Means by one or more factors

Source: R/utilities.R
means_by.Rd

Computes the mean for all numeric variables of a data frame, grouping by one or more factors.

means_by(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

A data frame
...

One or more categorical variables for grouping the data.

Value

An object of class tbl_df with the computed means by each level of the factor(s) declared in ....

Examples

# \donttest{
library(metan)
means_by(data_ge2, ENV)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 16
#>   ENV      PH    EH    EP    EL    ED    CL    CD    CW    KW    NR   NKR  CDED
#>   <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 A1     2.79  1.58 0.567  15.6  51.6  29.7  16.4  28.3  199.  16.9  33.9 0.576
#> 2 A2     2.46  1.31 0.527  15.2  48.7  28.5  15.9  23.8  168.  15.8  32.3 0.584
#> 3 A3     2.17  1.08 0.496  14.7  47.9  28.4  15.8  20.8  147.  15.8  30.4 0.595
#> 4 A4     2.52  1.41 0.558  15.1  49.9  29.4  15.8  26.4  177.  16.0  32.5 0.589
#> # … with 3 more variables: PERK <dbl>, TKW <dbl>, NKE <dbl>
means_by(data_ge2, GEN, ENV)
#> # A tibble: 52 x 17

#>    <fct> <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 H1    A1     2.72 1.68  0.626  15.4  51.1  28.1  15.7  23.5  203.  16.3  33.3

#>  3 H1    A3     2.20 1.10  0.497  14.8  50.6  30.9  15.8  26.8  157.  15.9  28.4
